result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack W Faude was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Recklessly Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Cause or Likely to Cause Bodily Harm, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.285(2)(a)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid in full by 12-29-2022 or penalty of civil judgment entered for non payment.

Costs to be paid with fine payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Huber with RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH AND TREATMENT.  Defendant to report to the Waukesha County Jail by 9:00 a.m. on 10-28-2022.

charges.descr: Recklessly Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Cause or Likely to Cause Bodily Harm

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

11:16 AM Defendant Jack W Faude in court.  Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Jack W Faude.  Attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Recommendations by the State.  Statement by Witness A.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
5 Days Huber with RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH AND TREATMENT.  Defendant to report to the Waukesha County Jail by 9:00 a.m. on 10/28/22.

FINE: $ 883.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA  Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid by 12/29/22.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.

9:23 AM Defendant Jack W Faude in court.  Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Jack W Faude.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
